text: The Burusho, or Brusho (Burushaski: , burúśuHunzai, A. N. N., Burushaski Research Academy, & University of Karachi. (2006). Burushaski Urdu Dictionary - Volume 1 / بروشسکی اردو لغت - جلد اول (الف تا څ). Bureau of Composition, Compilation & Translation, University of Karachi. ISBN 969-404-66-0 Archive.org) are an ethnic group native to the Yasin, Hunza, Nagar, and other valleys of Gilgit–Baltistan in northern Pakistan. Their language, Burushaski, has been classified as a language isolate, it means it is unrelated to any other language in the world. == References == Category:Ethnic groups in Pakistan
title: Burusho people
